bug.author: rmrao
bug.description:
System information
Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in TensorFlow): yes OS Platform and Distribution: Ubuntu 18.04 TensorFlow installed from (source or binary): binary TensorFlow version (use command below): 1.11 Python version: 3.6 CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.2/7.2.1 GPU model and memory: TitanXp 12Gb
When I use an Estimator with a MirroredDistributionStrategy, I encounter the error "AttributeError: 'Estimator' object has no attribute '_distribution'". This seems to be tied to this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/a6d8ffae097d0132989ae4688d224121ec6d8f35/tensorflow/python/estimator/estimator.py#L1330>line</denchmark-link> , which has . I'm pretty sure this should be . The estimator is clearly never assigned a '_distribution' attribute (this is the only line on which its referenced) so I assume this is just a typo. Let me know if I'm missing something.

comments.comment: Same problem on a fresh install from source from the master branch. I made that change and it works perfectly.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rmrao>@rmrao</denchmark-link> This should not be a problem with TF version 1.12. Have you tried with 1.12 ?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/Harshini-Gadige>@Harshini-Gadige</denchmark-link> This was broken when I did it on the master branch a few days ago, which is v1.12.
I havenâ€™t tried with 1.12 although the reference to _distribution still exists in the source of 1.12, so not sure that would do anything. I can test later today
This bug has been fixed in the master. 1.12 does have this bug.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rmrao>@rmrao</denchmark-link> - This issue is fixed and please wait for the next release. Thanks !

Are you satisfied with the resolution of your issue? <denchmark-link:https://goo.gl/forms/Oe0tEvODFRoI2gJF3>Yes</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://goo.gl/forms/fUjzOfrtkFbrOT8d2>No</denchmark-link>
